## Part 1. Set up Git and GitHub

1. Register for a (free) [GitHub](https://github.com/) account. You may want to also add the [Student Developer Pack](https://education.github.com/pack) to your account. [Slide](https://svteichman.github.io/STAT302-WIN2022/files/slides/07_debuggit.html#67)

2. Install Git on your computer. [Slide](https://svteichman.github.io/STAT302-WIN2022/files/slides/07_debuggit.html#60)

3. Introduce yourself to Git. [Slide](https://svteichman.github.io/STAT302-WIN2022/files/slides/07_debuggit.html#68)

4. Introduce your computer to GitHub. [Slide](https://svteichman.github.io/STAT302-WIN2022/files/slides/07_debuggit.html#70)

5. Create a Git repo for Short Lab 4 and clone it to your computer. [Slide](https://svteichman.github.io/STAT302-WIN2022/files/slides/07_debuggit.html#73)

6. Commit a local change using the shell. [Slide](https://svteichman.github.io/STAT302-WIN2022/files/slides/07_debuggit.html#75)

7. Delete your local repository, then use RStudio to clone your repository back to your computer and commit a local change using RStudio. [Slide](https://svteichman.github.io/STAT302-WIN2022/files/slides/07_debuggit.html#78)

8. If you use a private repository, add me and the grader as collaborators.
